Article.title: 'God Sent Angels': Syrian Migrant Recounts Rescue
Article.Description: Aliaa Hwijah, a journalist from Syria, was one of 24 migrants who have journeyed in recent months from the war-torn country to Europe.

Article.title: '19 Kids': Josh Duggar's Dad Advocated Death for Rapists
Article.Description: Josh Duggar's father, also a star of "19 Kids and Counting," said in a 2002 political campaign that rape should be punished by the death penalty.

Article.title: Actor Sam Shepard Arrested on DUI Charge in Santa Fe
Article.Description: The 71-year-old veteran performer told police he had consumed roughly two tequila drinks at a downtown Santa Fe restaurant on Monday evening.

Article.title: 'Too Much, Too Soon': Relentless Storms Leave 18 Dead, 16 Missing
Article.Description: At least 11 people in Texas and 7 in Oklahoma are dead after a series of storms caused flooding in the two states since Friday.

Article.title: '100 Deadly Days': U.S. Auto Deaths Spike Before Summer
Article.Description: The council found that monthly motor-vehicle deaths increased a total of 8 percent over the past six months compared to the same period a year before.

Article.title: Bernie Sanders: Campaign Will be 'A Movement of Millions'
Article.Description: Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders formally kicked off his underdog White House bid on Tuesday, promising to build a grassroots movement of millions ready to "to stand up and fight back."

Article.title: Cleveland Agrees to Broad Set of Police Reforms
Article.Description: The Justice Department concluded in December that Cleveland police had engaged in a pattern of excessive force and civil rights violations.

Article.title: Bones in Canyon Matched to Student Who Vanished in '82
Article.Description: Elisabeth Martinsson was attending the College of Marin and living with a California family when she disappeared.

Article.title: Bipolar Man's Death in Custody Sparks Georgia Jail Shakeup
Article.Description: Mathew Ajibade's family said he died after being Tasered and restrained in an isolation cell in the midst of a bipolar episode.

Article.title: Guns of Anarchy? Biker Gangs Prize Soldiers, Feds Say
Article.Description: Outlaw motorcycle gangs and support clubs actively recruit military personnel, according to the Bureau of Alcohol Tobacco and Firearms.

Article.title: James Holmes Trial: Notebook Details 'Obsession to Kill'
Article.Description: James Holmes considered several ways to satisfy his "obsession to kill" before he decided to shoot up a Colorado theater, according to his notebook.

Article.title: Court: Obama's Immigration Programs to Remain on Hold
Airman ID'd as Gunman in Deadly Wal-Mart Shooting
Article.Description: The shooter, 21-year-old Marcell Willis, fired at two employees with a handgun, killing one, police said. A motive was being investigated.

Article.title: Drinking May Be Bad for the Elderly Heart
Article.Description: Having a drink or two a day might be good for the heart when you're young, but even just a couple of drinks a day may damage an elderly heart.

Article.title: Paralyzed Student Walks Across Stage at Graduation
Article.Description: Chris Norton fractured his vertebrae during a football game in his freshman year and was told he had little chance of ever walking again.

Article.title: IRS: Thieves Stole Tax Info From 100,000 Taxpayers
Article.Description: The IRS says thieves used an online service provided by the agency to gain access to information from more than 100,000 taxpayers.

Article.title: 11-Year Catholic Protest Finally Faces a Reckoning
Article.Description: The archdiocese has declined to say what it would do if protesters refuse to leave.

Article.title: 'Pull Up!' Air France Jet Flew Too Close to Mountain
Article.Description: Investigators probe an Air France flight with dozens on board that narrowly avoided hitting the highest mountain in central Africa in early May.

Article.title: Revelers Gored at Festival Bullfights in Peru
Article.Description: At least three people were seriously injured over the weekend after they were gored during the annual bullfights held during Peru's traditional festival of the crosses.

Article.title: Swept Away: Eight in Vacation House Missing in Flood
Article.Description: "We are in a house that is now floating down the river. Call mom and dad. I love you. And pray."
